Posts.Content: Thank you for replying, the skin irritation is just how you describe and I'm finding the armpit area feels tighter and more uncomfortable as the day continues, then seems to settle down overnight and then repeat next day. It's slowly improving day by day, and you're right it's very early days for me. It's so good to have this community to share feelings with. I wish you all the best x
Posts.Title: Hello and skin sensitivity post lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hello, this is my first post. I was diagnosed with breast cancer about four weeks ago and had lumpectomy last Tuesday. I'm recovering well but have skin sensitivity on my upper arm on the same side, is this normal and does it diminish? Many thanks for reading
Posts.Title: Hello and skin sensitivity post lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Ah that's all good to know, thank you for replying. I'm finding it a little easier to move my arm today and the numbness/tingling is less of a strange sensation and more familiar so I'm less worried. It's good to share and have this forum x
Posts.Title: Hello and skin sensitivity post lumpectomy
